title: How to watch the Tour de France Femmes 2023
content:
Cyclist
How to watch the Tour de France Femmes 2023

The 2023 Tour de France Femmes kicks off in the city of Clermont-Ferrand on Sunday 23rd July, the same day the men’s Tour finishes over 400km away in Paris.

Over eight stages the women’s peloton will cover a total of just over 1,000km. The queen stage is set for the penultimate day of riding with an explosive finish atop the iconic Tourmalet and the Tour will finish in Pau with a 22km time-trial.

The Tour de France Femmes will be broadcast in 170 countries across Europe, the Asia-Pacific, the Middle East and North Africa – excluding China, Japan and New Zealand – by Discovery Sports on its channels Eurosport, GCN+ and Discovery+.

If you don’t have a Eurosport, GCN+ or Discovery+ subscription, British team Lifeplus-Wahoo are giving away 10,000 eight-day passes to GCN+ so you can watch every stage for free. Sign up at lifepluswahoo.com/embraceeverymoment and the first 10,000 will be sent a code. Please note this is only for those based in the UK.

• Check out our complete guide to the 2023 Tour de France Femmes

When can I watch the Tour de France Femmes 2023?

The following timings are in BST.

Stage 1: Sunday 23rd July

Starts at 1230 GCN+, Eurosport 1, Eurosport Player, Discovery+

Stage 2: Monday 24th July

Starts at 1325 GCN+, Eurosport 1, Eurosport Player, Discovery+

Stage 3: Tuesday 25th July

Starts at 1345 GCN+, Eurosport 1, Eurosport Player, Discovery+

Stage 4: Wednesday 26th July

Starts at 1240 GCN+, Eurosport 1, Eurosport Player, Discovery+

Stage 5: Thursday 27th July

Starts at 1420 GCN+, Eurosport 1, Eurosport Player, Discovery+

Stage 6: Friday 28th July

Starts at 1430 GCN+, Eurosport 1, Eurosport Player, Discovery+

Stage 7: Saturday 29th July

Starts at 1625 GCN+, Eurosport 1, Eurosport Player, Discovery+

Stage 8: Sunday 30th July

Starts at 1430 GCN+, Eurosport 1, Eurosport Player, Discovery+
